name: intronote
label: This is an example file for an introduction to ODK training. The data produced by this file will be used to demonstrate ODK protocols.

name: consent
label: Would you like to proceed with this survey?

name: stamp
label: Please record the date and time of this interview.

name: id
label: Please enter the enumerator ID (number from 1 to 99).
constraint message: You must enter a number from 1 to 99.

name: name
label: What is your name?

name: thanks
label: Thank you, ${name}, for agreeing to participate! Now, I'd like to ask a few questions about you.

name: title
label: What is your title?

name: age
label: How old are you?

name: calculatordisplay
label: A calculation: twice your age, ${age}, is ${calculator}.

name: favfruit
label: What is your ONE favorite kind of fruit from the options presented?

name: favveg
label: What kinds of vegetables do you like to eat?

name: researcharea
label: Which research area(s) do you work in?
hint: We're assuming we're interviewing only research staff. :)

name: thisyear
label: Have you worked on any research project(s) in the last 12 months?

name: introgroup
label: Now let's demo a traditional ODK "repeat group", or what we at IPA usually call a "table". We'll ask you to keep telling us about the project(s) you work on -- as long as you told us you've worked on at least one in the last 12 months.

name: introgroup2
label: Now, the application is going to ask you to "Add a new group" for each project you have worked on. It will cycle through a set of question for each new project/"group". Say yes until you're finished; then say no.

name: projects
label: projects

name: projectname
label: What is the name of this project?

name: projectfield
label: What is the primary field of study on your project, ${projectname}?

name: projectstatus
label: What is the current status of your project, ${projectname}?

name: projectdqa
label: Did you righteously and dutifully conduct data quality assurance for your project, ${projectname}?

name: endnote
label: Thank you! This is the end of the survey.

name: enumeratorcomment
label: Enumerator, please use this space to save any additional comments about this interview. Then, please move to the next screen to name and save your survey form.
